_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accident Prevention and Response Policies

Louis Dreyfus Storage LLC, Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility, in Petal, Mississippi is a liquified petroleum gas storage facility.  The gases stored are propane and butane.  The facility utilizes certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary on-site human exposure and to minimize the potential for any offsite exposure.  These safety precautions include: 
effectively managing our process operations; 
investing in the latest process safety technologies; 
training and retraining our personnel; 
reviewing our processes for hazards on a continuous basis; 
ensuring safety is considered in process design, installation, operations and maintenance.  

The facility maintains a policy to be a good business partner; a safe and conscientious neighbor; and to operate in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.


Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

Louis Dreyfus Storage LLC, Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility contains the RMP regulated flammable substances of propane and butane.


The General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

The Terminal Superintendent has overall responsibility for ensuring that our facility operates in a safe and reliable manner.  However, all personnel ensure that safe work practices, equipment design specifications, and maintenance schedules are adhered to thereby reducing the probability of an accident at the facility.

Louis Dreyfus Storage LLC has developed programs to comply with all environmental, health, and safety laws.  We take a systematic, proactive approach to preventing accidental releases.  Our risk management program addresses each of the essential features of successful accident prevention programs, including:
Process Safety Information
Process Hazard Analysis
Operating Procedures
Training
Mechanical Integrity
Management of Change
Pre-Startup Safety Review
Compliance Audits
Incident Investigation
Employee Partcipation
Hot

Work Permits
Contractor Safety

We employ extensive mechanical integrity and preventative maintenance programs to ensure the integrity of our equipment and safety systems.  Our mechanical integrity program uses equipment surveillance and preventative maintenance activities to identify equipment that may be deteriorating and in need of repair or replacement, before failure occurs.  This program also specifies the repairs and/or parts needed to return equipment to acceptable specifications.

We train our employees to safety perform their assigned tasks.  Our training program includes initial training as well as periodic refresher training and training updates when major process or equipment changes are made.


Five-Year Accident History

Louis Dreyfus Storage LLS, Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility has had no accidents that meet the criteria for the Five-Year Accident History.


Emergency Response Program

Louis Dreyfus Storage LLC is a member of the Petal Dome Mutual Aid (PDMA) group.  The PDMA has an emergency response plan which details procedures for accidental releases and includes notification of the Forrest County LEPC and other local authorities.  We maintain an "open door" policy with local emergency response organizations to help ensure maximum understanding and cooperation during an emergency.


Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Louis Dreyfus Storage LLC, Hattiesburg LPG Storage Facility personnel continually strive to improve all aspects of our safety programs to protect our workers and the public.
